channel.title: NG - Current Release backlog for reporting (Cengage Learning JIRA)

item.title: [NG-12459] (BLOCKED)Need a cleanup script to remove snapshots that we're introduced in production during the 2.3 release
item.description:
This may be migrated to a config ticket or solely an MTOPS - but wanted to get this on the board somewhere.

We should probably go in and clean up data associated with the 2160 duplicate readermode snapshots that were created as a result of the bug introduced w/ 2.3 in production.

This query gets all the snapshot records :
select count from SNAPSHOT where ISBN like '%:ZZZ'

We should look to clean up the following:

Short term :
SNAPSHOT, NODE, ACTIVITY, ORG_SNAPSHOT and SNAPSHOT_APP_DATA tables in Mysql

One of the big issues is that there are far to many snapshots on the shared org - that it takes some time for that Org page to load, and finding the real RM snapshot is a hassle.

The very, very short term might be to remove these records from the ORG_SNAPSHOT table - which should clear up the UI.

Longer Term :

Clean up the mongo collections of all of this data. Maybe part of a larger ticket to cleanup mongo for all deleted, obsoleted, orphaned contentKeys (tracked separately).

delete these snapshots from the elastic search index - can this be done manually w/ a service call/script?
item.summary: (BLOCKED)Need a cleanup script to remove snapshots that we're introduced in production during the 2.3 release

comments.comment: Review this with Jeff when this is picked up please
Dev Reviewed by Karen.

Added a NG-12459 folder under ng-istruct/datatools.

This contains 2 scripts:

1) deletesnapshots.rb - this contains the code to retrieve the snapshot ids and then delete them one by one using an existing deleteMaster service.This deletes the snapshot both from MySQL & Mongodb.

2) deletesnapshots.sh - this a shell script which invokes the ruby script mention in Step 1 with supplied params. This script should be modified according to the environment it is executed in.

For the historical purpose attached txt file that contains ID, CORE_TEXT_ISBN, ISBN of snapshots that we are deleting.
File contains records with ID|CORE_TEXT_ISBN|ISBN format.

The APP REMOVED event failures occur when trying to delete the snapshot.
There were in mindtap.log that I have captured and attached here for reference in a separate text file. These errors occurred for the two snapshots I was trying to delete.

I am also putting below a copy of what I was seeing on my console when running the script (for ease).
I started to print to the HTTP responses and response codes for each HTTP request when trying to understand what was going on.

$ ./deletesnapshots.sh qae-ng.cengage.com as_test_admin@test.cengage.com password 10.160.246.117 rouser readonly
Authenticating and storing cookies...

Auth response code: 302
Retrieving snapshot ids from 10.160.246.117 and deleting them ....

Snapshot ID: 65
http://qae-ng.cengage.com/nb/service/master/65

Deleting snapshot id: 65
412
[{"ERROR_CODE":"APP_LIFE_CYCLE-1001","ERROR_DESC":"Unable to send the snapshotDelete notification due to lack of response from app"}]
Failed
Snapshot ID: 10627
http://qae-ng.cengage.com/nb/service/master/10627

Deleting snapshot id: 10627
412
[{"ERROR_CODE":"APP_LIFE_CYCLE-1001","ERROR_DESC":"Unable to send the snapshotDelete notification due to lack of response from app"}]
Failed

Deletion completed

The reason why that script was blowing up in QAE is due to the fact that the snapshots there have parent_id field as null in SNAPSHOT mysql table, and during the delete flow the notification logic tries to grab that value and throws NullPointerException.
I did confirm that the production snapshots we are trying to delete also have parent_id null for all of them.
After discussing it with Apoorva we modified the script to insert a master snapshot id into the parent_id field of affected snapshots and the delete them.

Tested this on MT DEV. It ran fine and deleted all 2160 records BUT
After 36 mins. the script timed out with the following error. It takes approx 41 mins for the script to run and delete everything
Deleting snapshot id: 13519 /Users/apsharma/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p327/lib/ruby/1.9.1/net/protocol.rb:146:in `rescue in rbuf_fill': Timeout::Error (Timeout::Error)
from /Users/apsharma/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p327/lib/ruby/1.9.1/net/protocol.rb:140:in `rbuf_fill'
from /Users/apsharma/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p327/lib/ruby/1.9.1/net/protocol.rb:122:in `readuntil'

from /Users/apsharma/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p327/lib/ruby/1.9.1/net/http.rb:2551:in `read_new'

from deletesnapshots.rb:72:in `block in <main>'
from /Users/apsharma/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p327/gems/ruby-mysql-2.9.10/lib/mysql.rb:674:in `call'
from /Users/apsharma/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p327/gems/ruby-mysql-2.9.10/lib/mysql.rb:674:in `each'
from deletesnapshots.rb:69:in `<main>'

I have modified the delete script as follows:

1) the script will run in nohup mode so that if you accidentally close the terminal window from where you started, it will continue to run in backgorund.
2) the script logs everything to a log file called 'deleteSnapshots.log', no more console output.
3) timeout value has been increased to 120 seconds from default of 30 earlier (this can further be adjusted if needed)
4) in case of a TimeOut an Error is logged in the logfile and it continues with the next snapshot

Please run it again.
We don't anticipate running this until sometime after 2.5 is in production...so updating this ticket to 2.6
Marking this as Blocked until we get Dave Randall sometime after the release and clean up production. For more details, please check with Jeff.

item.title: [NG-13013] SPIKE: Determine proper settings for alignment of MathML content
item.description:
We’re trying to change the alignment of offset MathML in MT based on a position attribute we apply to the <cl:math-expr> wrapping tag. But, even though the transform is including the alignment value in the xhtml, it’s not coming over to the css.

XML: <cl:math-expr identifier="DXSTNR067428193" position="right">
Transform converts to: <div class="math" id="DXSTNR067428193" style="right">
But, Scott sees: <div class="MathJax_SVG_Display" role="textbox" aria-readonly="true" style="text-align: center;">

Even though we’re applying this attribute on the <cl:math-expr> instead of the <math>, it appears that MathJax rendering is getting in the way. This is being researched as a way to move alignment from the MathML to the css – because we’re finding that it’s taking the conversion vendors a lot more time to manually code proper alignment into the MathML.

Spike Outcomes
determine if alignment override requires platform development, create stories to identify requirements
Work with editorial, transform and UX(CSS) teams to determine proper tagging and transform settings to get this to work
item.summary: SPIKE: Determine proper settings for alignment of MathML content

comments.comment:
Attaching example of this issue from Uberdoc (section 13-3).

In this example, we had to add a lot of hardcoded spaces to align the 2nd equation with the first (spaces highlighted yellow). If we were able to set the 2 equations to right align, we could avoid those manual spaces.

Approach 1: Changing CSS and styling on elements.
Components to be changed : Transform, Application CSS/javascript code.
     - Transform needs to convert position="right" to style="text-align:right"
     - If there is no position attribute on cendoc then transform should default to "center" alignment
     - Application/CSS : Remove "text-alignment" styles from "equation" and "Math_SVG_Display" classes
     - Application/Javascript : Remove inline style attribute text-align from math div.

Approach 2 : Changing MathML
Components to be changed : Cendoc
     - Instead of using multiple empty <mtext>, use "mspace" tag with required width. Ex : <mspace width="18em"/>
       http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-MathML/chap3_2.html#sec3.2.6
Files attached for both approaches.

Points from dev review :
  - Using <mtext> and <mspace> is not good for accessibility.
  - Using <mspace> would require a refresh of titles with cendoc change.
  - First approach seems more reasonable and gives better control of formula alignment.
  - First approach would require a refresh of ALL math titles as math alignment will be removed from CSS and will be added to reader.xml during transform.
  - General consensus was using the first approach.

Need to discuss with Carrie as this involves title refresh.
what is the impact of requiring a refresh of all titles that contain MathML if this change is implemented? How many titles would this affect and are any in use (besides class test MT's)?

Option 1 was chosen
need to create stories and estimate

MathML is expected to be used in about 72 of our c2014 titles. But the bulk of these will have 2 Masters: RM and CM. About 30 of the 72 are expected to be built on Production environment by January 30th. The rest will be built February through April.

Carrie, I'd like to understand better what happens if a Master is *not* refreshed after this change goes live.

And, if making this change limits us in other alignment requirements associated with MathJax. I'm just not sure what the impact is of moving this from the CSS/Javascript to the Transform for the long haul.

I still agree we need to support this on the platform/transform-side rather than hardcoding spaces into our XML, but I just want to make sure this approach will align well with other requirements (yet to be determined)

Modified math.xsl has been pushed to Master and QAE. New XHTML (Uberdoc example):

<div class="math" id="DXSTNR067428193" style="text-align:right">

As requested, if there is no "position" attribute in the XML, the transform now provides style="text-align:center".

item.title: [NG-11572] SPIKE: Math: Accessiblity and MathML
item.description:
What is possible here if the rendering solution is mathJAX-SVG rendering?

Can something be done to put the reading into a mode where a screen reader can read it?

Spike Outcomes:
need to test if this works in uberdoc, if not, create an independent page that works
determine if current rendering solution works with Screen readers
what changes if any are required to either the rendering solution and/or the way we store the Mathml content for the screen readers to work,or is it MathJAX
are changes necessary further upstream in the capturing of the content in order for screen readers to read mathml content? (work with Tim Butz on this, if necessary)

check out:
http://www.mathjax.org/resources/articles-and-presentations/accessible-pages-with-mathjax/
item.summary: SPIKE: Math: Accessiblity and MathML

comments.comment: Please add details as to the investigation and work that you have done to-date on MathML and accessibility.

Tim Butz has been working with Dave Schleppenbach at GH, Inc at http://gh-accessibility.com/ from the content side. Please loop them into this discussion to look at accessibility wholistically (both content and platform)

item.title: [NG-12391] (Demo) Add/ Remove Highlight for a formula (no text)
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to add or remove a highlight an inline- or block-level formula in a reading activity so that I can annotate the readings to help me study

Acceptance Criteria

  • Adding a highlight: click to select either an inline formula or a block level formula
  • contextual menu appears with add highlight function
  • click add highlight with any color
  • should show highlight on math objects
  • REmoving a highligt: click to select inline or block mathml element,contextual menu displays,click REmove Highlight
    • highlight is removed
    • contextual menu disappears

Scenario: click an inline formula and choose to highlight
When I choose to highlight from the menu
Then the formula appears highlighted with the color selected
And the menu disappears

Scenario: click a block-level formula and choose to highlight

When I click thru a block-level formula
Then I see a formula highlighting menu

When I choose to highlight from the menu
Then the formula appears highlighted
And the menu disappears

Scenario: click on a formula and choose not to highlight

When I click on a block-level formula
Then I see a formula highlighting menu

When I mouse away from the formula
Then the menu disappears

Scenario: change color of a highlight on a standalone formula
when I click on an existing highlight on a standalone formula and change color
then I see the highlight color change

  • for all scenarios -
    • the highlight will stay on the page when the user navigates away and returns or logs out and returns
    • the highlights app will display the selection and allow cross-navigation back to the reader page

Out of scope scenarios:

  • Highlighting multiple formulas in a single selection
  • Highlighting formulas in a table or an image caption
  • add note to formula only
  • text plus math (with no ending text is not supported)
  • math plus text (with no starting text)
item.summary: (Demo) Add/ Remove Highlight for a formula (no text)

comments.comment:
Hi Nitin, can you please have someone do a pass on this story across browsers on QAE?


* Please identify and log an issues you are sure of.
* If you are not sure then please email the issues discovered.
* Please leave the story in QA Active so that Geetha and Iryna can review in the morning on remaining issues.

Verified this Story across the browsers FF/Chrome/IE/Safari and found that "Formulas are not getting highlighted by selected colors though updated in My Notes app."
We also filed a separate ticket for same as NG-13297.
linking the bug filed on this story.

item.title: [NG-12713] (Demo) QA: verify Support extend/merge highlights for text and MathML
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to be able to extend and merge content blocks which include a math formula so that it the functionality works the same as standard text.

When a user creates a new highlight within an existing highlighted section it will merge the complete existing highlight along with any new user selected text including MathML. The merged content will then be updated in the Notepad as a single entry, and likely with a merge into a single entry into the database.

Extending/Merging Scenarios:
We need to consider the merging and extension into any one of the content blocks with the other:

Content Blocks

  • selection cannot begin/end on mathml
    • can contain mathml in middle of text selection
  • Text
item.summary: (Demo) QA: verify Support extend/merge highlights for text and MathML

comments.comment: QA story to determine what is working/what is not

Below merge and extend HL scenarios are being tested on QAE across browsers.

Merge scenario tested:
1) Create a HL over math (text+math+text) with one color
2) Check it rendered on reader and notepad.
3) Extend the HL by adding some text before and after the above created HL (addln text+above created HL+addln text) with another color.
4) Check the rendering and color change in the NP.
5)Navigate few pages away , chapters away and come back to reader.
6)Navigate to another chapter and navigate back to HL via NP

Extend HL scenarip tested:
1) Create a HL(a) over math (text+math+text) with one color
2) On the same page leaving some para/text/text with math , create an another HL(b) below (text+math+text) with another color.
3)Check it rendered on reader and notepad.
4) Merge both the HL with the in between additional para/text/text with math included (i.e. start with HL(a) and end at HL(b)) and choose a thrid color
5) Check the rendering and color change in the NP.
6)Navigate few pages away , chapters away and come back to reader.
7)Navigate to another chapter and navigate back to HL via NP)

Above scenario result in different OS/Browser combination:
MacOS:
FF - PASS
Chrome - PASS
Safari - PASS

Win 7:
IE9 - PASS
Chrome - PASS
Safari - PASS

item.title: [NG-12714] (Demo)Add/Edit/Remove Quicknotes for selected MathML content
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to add, edit or remove a quicknote associated to mathml content so that I can annotate the readings to help me study

Acceptance Criteria

  • Adding a Quicknote(QN): select either a standalone math formula or text&mathml and
  • contextual menu appears with Add Note option
  • Add note,click Save
    • contextual menu disappears
  • should show highlight on selected entity
  • Margin Mark appears to denote QuickNote
  • Quicknote and highlight excerpt appear in Highlights/Notepad App
  • Editing a Quicknote(QN): select the Margin Mark associated to either a standalone math formula or text&mathml that has an existing QN associated to it
  • quicknote displays
  • Click Edit, Update note,click Save
    • QN window closes
  • highlight remains on selected entity
  • Margin Mark remains to denote QuickNote
  • UPdated Quicknote and highlight excerpt appear in Highlights/Notepad App
  • Removing a Quicknote(QN): select the Margin Mark associated to either a standalone math formula or text&mathml that has an existing QN associated to it
  • quicknote displays
  • Click Delete Note
    • QN window closes
  • highlight on selected entity is removed
  • Margin Mark is removed
  • Quicknote and highlight excerpt are removed from Highlights/Notepad App
  • testing scenario - quicknotes on top highlights
  • QA will verify navigation from Highlights app to reader

Note: selecting Cancel in QuickNote pop-up during any of the workflows will not create,update nor delete the Quicknote

Out of scope scenarios:

  • Highlighting multiple formulas in a single selection
  • Highlighting formulas in a table or an image caption
  • highlighting text + formula only or formula + text only
item.summary: (Demo)Add/Edit/Remove Quicknotes for selected MathML content

comments.comment:
most of this seems to be done. There is an issue where the note icon is obscured in the Highlights app.
Need to work with QA to determine what is/is not supported and fix what is not working
Review with QA before picking it up to develop, so we can see which ACs are complete, and which are not.

Case which is not working when QN on top of HL are created:
1. select text+formula+text and create HL.
2. Click on the FORMULA (not on text) and add Notes.
Result:
 - highlighted color is removed from the page;
 - though MM is displayed, clicking on it does not call out QN window and throws error on Firebug;
 - in Notepad only formula is displayed.

TypeError: notepos is null
http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nbapps/notepad/provider/quicknote.js
Line 52

After switching Chapters/refresh: MM and color are on the page but color indicates only formula; MM is working (can edit/delete), in Notepad only formular is displayed.

item.title: [NG-13008] Enable MathJAX only in MT's that have MathML content
item.description:
as a user, I don't want to have MathJAX loaded for MT's that do not have MathML content so the reader loads more quickly

Acceptance Criteria
based on attribute set in the transform, only enable MathJAX in MT based on the existence of this attribute
see MTQA-16767

  • this setting in MT needs to be global so it is read before a reading activity is launched. LPN,and apps will read this setting
  • will require refresh of all MathML MT's
  • can the default be if this attribute does not exist then don't load in MathJAX- only MathML MT's will be refreshed and will contain this attribute
  • what kind of attribute needs to be added to the HTML from the xform to identify this ?
item.summary: Enable MathJAX only in MT's that have MathML content

item.title: [NG-12866] (Wait: NG-10751) Provide ability to prevent/allow a snapshot to be created from a Master
item.description:
as a superadmin user only, I want a way to either prevent a snapshot from being created or to allow a snapshot to be created (if currently disabled) so I can clear an existing 'lock' on creation or prevent creation (if there is an error in the MT)

Acceptance criteria

  • checkbox in the create/edit Master dialog box enable/disable a snapshot from being created from the Master
  • when the Master is locked (and the edit Master dialog cannot be opened), the hover over pop-up will identify both the lock status and the prevent snapshot creation and allow those locks to be removed(independently of one another)
    the hover over tooltip needs to be changed from Locked to Access Restricted
    • The lock icon appears in the master's cell for any of the restricted options. Note: THe pencil icon will not appear when the Lock status is true
  • when the superadmin unchecks the lock snapshot creation, a warning message will be issued
    • check with Cindy on wording (message should indicate that snapshots created may not contain all of the HW app updates
item.summary: (Wait: NG-10751) Provide ability to prevent/allow a snapshot to be created from a Master

comments.comment: doing the UI work for this one with NG-10751, as they are almost identical.

item.title: [NG-12323] [Wait 2.5 release] MongoDB connection pool errors
item.description:
Business Impact: This issue can cause any database operation to fail. For example, on the day of the release, a snapshot creation failed rendering Super Admin MindTap Masters view unusable until the snapshot was manually cleaned up.

During the production release of 2.3 we start seeing a small number of these errors related to Mongo connection pooling:

exception.ResourceExceptionInterceptor – Uncaught Exception from Resource Method: java.lang.RuntimeException: trying to put something back in the pool wasn't checked out

These errors are causing various transactions to fail. They only seem to be occurring at server startup in production (need more data here). QA logs show these errors have occurred there as well dating back to Sept 25th in QAE.
item.summary: [Wait 2.5 release] MongoDB connection pool errors

Although we're not sure of user-facing impact of this - we need to investigate in 2.4 timeframe to understand what is happening
Likely related to the mongo java driver upgrade on 9/20: https://github.com/CengageEng/ng-nbcore/commit/c721085191d91237c95d9c4abb01f9913af3cb7b
As a point of reference, this error happened fourteen times in production on 10/18.

Load tests today ran into these errors, but to such a degree that they cause the test to fail. There were over 1300 errors across 10 servers in a 15 minute period, between 1:15AM and 1:30AM. Kokab had to restart the Tomcat servers, which resolved the issues. It is not certain whether it would have resolved itself without the restart. But it seems that heavy load can cause / aggrevate this issues.

This load test failure raises the priority on this ticket.
Added a the Business Impact to the description
Check with Nader on this before picking it up

Note - I do see this exception for a couple of Masters in production in the Push error status :

Mankiw_Principles of Microeconomics_6e_CM (SSO ISBN: 9781133353997) : masterId 572: java.lang.RuntimeException: trying to put something back in the pool wasn't checked out

Mankiw_Principles of Macroeconomics_6e_CM (SSO ISBN: 9781133354031) : push exception for masterId 97: java.lang.RuntimeException: trying to put something back in the pool wasn't checked out

A load test will be run in QAP environment with latest Mongo driver to see if new driver resolves this issue.

The following CI build uses latest mongo driver (2.10.1) http://pipeeng.corp.local:8080/hudson/job/ng-nbcore-MASTER_PACKAGE_PUBLISH/505/
The change has been reverted on master branch so that QA can continue regular testing with old driver.

We verified that the QAP Mongo instance is in the Delta silo, which previously had the connection timeout issues.

We deployed the latest code to QAP and disabled the monitors to ensure no requests would keep the connections alive. We let the environment sit idle for 4 hours, after which we attempted to access the. This version of code (which included the forked custom Mongo drivers) did not experience any timeout/idle connection errors. All requests returned normally. Next step is to deploy the current Mongo drivers and determine whether they do or don't experience the stale connection issue.

After 2.5 hours of idle time in QA I re-tested the mongo connections, but did not see any connection errors. Now, this could be because the new drivers handle the lost connections silently. Or it could be that QAP's configuration does not replicate the original conditions that caused originally caused the issue. A third possibility is that I simply didn't wait long enough. We have to possible next steps if we wish to prove we are resolving this issue. 1) we revert the mongo drivers all the way back to the version for which we originally spotted the issue and re-test OR 2) when we have this environment back for 2.6 activities, we leave it in this idle configuration for a much longer time period, >8hrs.
I added a query in Splunk to detect these errors: It's called "Mongo Pool Errors" under the mindtap_prod app.

item.title: [NG-7470] Progress: Ability to Drop Student (Deactivate)
item.description:
As an Instructor, CourseCare or SuperAdmin I need the ability to drop a student from a course so that their lack of scores does not negatively impact the class average

Background

Instructors wish to be able to remove a student from their MT course. MT will inform Cengage Brain (where relevant - does not apply to MindTaps utilizing MindLinks) and the homework apps (where relevant - only applies to homework apps that track students in their courses)

Acceptance Criteria

  • Display Deactivate Student button on an individual student's page in the Progress app
  • Clicking on the Deactivate Student button opens the Deactivate Student confirmation dialog
  • Deactivate Student confirmation dialog display:
    • Text: Are you sure you want to drop <Student First Name> <Student Last Name>?
    • Button: Yes, drop this student
    • If the course utilizes MindLinks only: Display additional text: This will drop the student from MindTap only. Removing the student from your LMS must be done separately.
    • If clicked, the dialog closes and the user is returned to the main student tab. The deactivated student no longer appears in the student list and:
      • The student no longer appears in the Progress app:
      • Any existing recorded scores are not displayed in the Progress app
      • Any existing scores are not used in any calculations, ie) class average
      • Class average will be recalculated
      • Instructor View of LPN and Progress: student not included in # of students or total # of students
      • The dropped student and any of their scores are not included in the Export file.
        ***If the student belongs to an institution which uses MindLinks grade synch, the dropped student's scores will be synched if it changes (only possible via a rescore from a homework app). This is an edge case as most likely the student would be dropped in the LMS and not MT and rescore is an infrequent occurance.

The following should also occur, though part of separate stories:

      • If the course goes through Cengage Brain, MT informs Cengage Brain the student has dropped. If the course utilizes MindLinks, this notification will not be sent. (NG-12452)

See preliminary implementation notes at: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/Roster+Service+and+Drop+Student+MindTap+Implementation+Notes
item.summary: Progress: Ability to Drop Student (Deactivate)

comments.comment: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-7470+Progress++Ability+to+Deactivate+a+Student++-+aka+Drop+Student

Thoughts:
1. Adding new columns in UserOrgProfile
2. Way to fire trigger on the activate/deactivate which calculate the class average, currently trigger fires on update of Activity_Outcome table.

item.title: [NG-10750] Prevent Snapshot creation when W.C. Save is in progress
item.description:
as a production, editor or superadmin user, I don't want a snapshot to be created from the Master MT when the Working Copy is being saved because the snapshot could be in a weird state

Acceptance criteria

  • When a working copy is being saved into the Master, then prevent a new snapshot from being created (either from CB or via fulfillment URL)
  • prevent snapshot creation when user selects YES to confirmation message to save WC back into Master
  • send a message back to students and instructors from either Gateway(MindLinks) or Cengage Brain (dashboard) access
    • separate message for instructors - to try again from the instructor dashboard or LMS
    • for students- message to indicate that course has not been created yet;to contact their instructor
  • if snapshot prevention had been enabled prior to WC creation/Save, then a successful save into Master will clear the snapshot prevention flag

NOTE - this restriction should be independent of the existing Master Lock functionality

Implementation Considerations

  • set flag to prevent snapshot creation when Save to master is selected; release flag when wc commit is complete and wc is deleted
  • for MT with no new Apps (or Apps that do not use WC commit events) remove flag when working copy save is finished
item.summary: Prevent Snapshot creation when W.C. Save is in progress

comments.comment: raising from 3 to 4 pts; assumes refactoring

item.title: [NG-10751] Provide ability to prevent/allow a working copy to be created from a Master
item.description:
as a superadmin user only, I want a way to either prevent a WC from being created or to allow a WC to be created (if currently disabled) so I can clear an existing 'lock' on creation or prevent creation (if there is an error in the MT)

Acceptance criteria

  • checkbox in the create/edit Master dialog box to enable/disable a WC from being created from the Master
  • Create WC icon will be disabled when WC creation is 'locked'
  • when the Master is locked (and the edit Master dialog cannot be opened), the hover over pop-up will identify both the lock status and the prevent WC creation and allow those locks to be removed(independently of one another).
    • the hover over tooltip needs to be changed from Locked to Access Restricted
item.summary: Provide ability to prevent/allow a working copy to be created from a Master

comments.comment: Scott, Wireframes are needed for this please. This will likely be done in Jan or Feb. thanks, carrie
Carrie, let me know if we need to review in case there was a part I didn't understand correctly
Hover text for the lock icon should now read "Access Restricted"

item.title: [NG-10795] Prevent Working Copy creation until acknowledgement has been received from the homework apps
item.description:
As a production, editor or superadmin user, I want to prevent working copy creation til all apps have acknowledged it's ability to commit the (last) working copy changes in their app so that I know that the HW apps are in sync with the Master.

Steps to get into this situation:
1. Create a working copy
2. Make changes
3. If changes are made in a homework app, the app is notified via lifecycle events of each change.
4. Commit working copy to master and send notification to commit working copy changes to homework app
5. MT should NOT wait to receive an acknowledgement from the homework app before proceeding to commit working copy changes on MT side.
BUT
6. (MT will prevent Snapshot creation-part of NG-12425), a new WC creation and (Push to Snapshot,part of NG-12426) till the acks are received or an admin override is performed.

Creating a snapshot while in this state will result in the snapshot being created without the working copy changes in the homework app and we can't allow another WC to be created until the ACK is received from the original commit

Acceptance criteria

  • If working copy commit notification to homework app has a status of In Progress:
    • allow the commit WC changes on MindTap side but prevent a new WC from being created until the ACK has been received by MT.
  • visual representation of this 'locked state' must be visually different than the current Lock a Master MT functionality
  • will unlock automatically when the ACK is returned successfully

Testing Note

  • there could be HW from more than one app in a MT. Need to check additions/deletions of HW Activities in a WC for all HW Apps, and combos of them

10/22/12 notes
-Modify the story to allow the commit to complete but do not allow WC/Snapshot to be created from the Master.

  • HW Apps will continue to queue the incoming messages and will sent the ACK back as it is processed. the HW apps have a timeout of 6 hours if the commit was unsuccessful
item.summary: Prevent Working Copy creation until acknowledgement has been received from the homework apps

item.title: [NG-12311] Launch reader with init/launch app rather than url hash
item.description:
AC:

  • Clui.hub.pub('appAction.data.update') for navigate.update subscribe event (i.e., launching reader from lpn) and refactor nb_dock.launch version has been implemented.
  • Reader.js uses data sent via appAction.data.update
  • All $.route event listeners have been removed and replaced with model attribute change listeners
  • All locations that depend upon location information being in the hash have been updated.
    **This spans a number of files (content view, bookmarks, etc) What are other files?

We can use the existing Clui.hub.pub('appAction.data.update') code in nb_app_controller.js to launch an app rather than a url. Currently this is used with the large tables popout.js to hand data to the app on launch. It could be co-opted to run with reader. the nb apps controller would hand in launch data like tocId, chapterId, sectionId, elementId, etc and then reader would receive that information and respond by navigating to location. This update code would also work when reader was already open but needed to respond to a navigation change. We would then update all places that launch/update the location of the reader with the same update code so that opening and navigating in reader flow through one API.

There is a quick and dirty bit of code in branch https://github.com/CengageEng/ng-ui/tree/NG-12167 that shows this idea in action for some scenarios like launching both regular and fullbook readers as well as a few bookmark scenarios.

Want to update launch of reader so it happens via a Clui.app launch function similar or a refactored Clui.app.update that popout.js uses now. This would replace the launch via url hash parameters.
Reasons:
-url hash history adds complexity and doesn’t mesh well with lpn history when using browser back button.
-app update is a simpler API that is less vulnerable to timing/race condition issues
-supports separation of launch location data vs. display or state data when launching reader

What is involved
1. Need to implement Clui.hub.pub('appAction.data.update') for navigate.update subscribe event (i.e., launching reader from lpn) and refactor nb_dock.launch version to fit new implementation.
2. Need to update reader.js so that it uses data sent via appAction.data.update

3. Need to remove all $.route event listeners and replace with model attribute change listeners (this pattern is currently already used with page change)

4. Need to update all locations that depend upon location information being in the hash. This spans a number of files (content view, bookmarks, etc)

5. LPN has been updated to call correct launch code.
item.summary: Launch reader with init/launch app rather than url hash

item.title: [NG-11278] Improve speed of reader loading via css loading improvements

As a developer, I want to hand the bookID from the LPN to the reader at launch so that we can improve reader performance.

Currently we load book specific css AFTER the asynchronous call for the reading model is successful. If we handed the bookId from the lpn to the reader at launch, we could improve the rendering speed of the reader page.

AC:

  • Update code which sets the source of the iFrame to include bookID as parameter
  • Update Reader to load style sheets at top of the page
item.summary: Improve speed of reader loading via css loading improvements

item.title: [NG-11595] Configure font styling for math for inline, block and large tables
item.description:
Adjust font size and weight in rendered math formulas in the following locations so it appears similar to font size/weight of surrounding text Currently the font appears larger and bolder (as in implying emphasis) than the surrounding text

  • Main-flow, inline
  • Main-flow, block
  • Enlarged table view

Biggest concerns are font weight and size

  • review linked MTQA tickets with Tim and Emily with this change/update

review complex fraction type equations which tend to appear in a smaller font size (need example from uberdoc)- These will not be addressed with a font change. These will be handled via zooming (in a separate ticket)

Example screen shots attached
See screenshot attached to http://jira.cengage.com/browse/MTQA-13391
Uberdoc locations for testing (there are more but this is a representative example)
Table: section 13-2a: table 4.1
complex fraction type: 12-1 (two examples)
inline vs. block: 12-2a, Example 18, 13-1d

Global Change in reader to include:

  • Addressing varying font size between inline and block MathML
  • Adjusting Font Size/Weight in:
    • TOC links
    • Chapter Headings in Reader and Full Book
    • Chapter name in the header above a Reading Activity
    • LPN
    • Glossary Terms and Definitions
    • Chapter Title widget
    • Skimmer
    • enlargeable images
    • large tables
      NOTE the elements above will need to be reviewed separately to determine impact of the size/weight change. IT may be that the global change has an adverse affect on one or more of these elements. We may choose to ignore the side effect for this initial implementation and create a separate story(ies) for each of the elements as needed.

out of scope:

    • Flashcards

refer to http://www.mathjax.org/docs/2.0/options/SVG.html for the options available to the SVG renderer as well as their defaults

Investigate how to make the font name/size we pass in configurable in a settings file instead of hard-wired into the java
item.summary: Configure font styling for math for inline, block and large tables

comments.comment: Changing from Medium to H/C, but also reduced scope of this ticket based on feedback from Editorial stakeholders.

Risk:
this is subjective
need to determine "good enough point"- work with emily/Tim

Attaching an email (Boldface Variables in OWL) that explains how boldface is used to identify question variables in OWL, so using a MathJAX font that makes Chemistry notations appear bolder than surrounding text in MT Reader will cause confusion for student.
Attaching "Boldface_Variables in OWL" email as Word doc
When this is picked up, please note that this card has not been discussed with QA yet. Please arrange a conversation with QA and PO.

Ravish and I did quite a bit of analysis, and ran our findings by Carrie/Abhi/Emily/Tim.

We tried a javascript solution which uses vector sizing to change the font after the math is rendered. It rendered the math very nicely, but you see it visibly shrink (from 100% to 85%) after rendering, especially on pages with lots of math. The bouncing wasn't considered ideal by Emily/Tim, so we didn't implemnet it.

For now, we have implemented a "font-size" CSS change, which makes the math 85% of its original size. We also changed the "blacker" (font weight) from 10 to 7. The font-size change is not perfect - sometimes it get fuzzy, and in Chrome/Mac, we see the bottom getting cut off sometimes. Especially in large tables. In needs more investigation, to see if it is acceptable for now.

The MathJax 2.1 release is still in beta. We downloaded it and tried it, because we were told that a bug in the "scale" setting was fixed there. It is fixed... It worked better, but it is still not as perfect as we would like. It still does not use vector sizing, which is what we expected. Still, it's better. When this is released officially, we should change to using its scale setting. There is already a card for this, NG-12340.

Some of the limitations we will still face with 2.1 are: changing size of individual elements - like titles, or inline/block, or other details. We experimented with using the "scale" attribute along with CSS font-size changes, and this might be a viable solution.

Karen, can you please work with Baraa to make sure that we have another story for the "scale" attribute along with CSS font-size changes option. I'll then work with Emily and Tim to get this prioritized, if necessary. thanks

Per Carrie's request, we verified this on IE9, and it looks better than Chrome. Marking as Dev Complete.

Baraa will modify NG-12342 to include making a variety of individual elements have different math sizing.
Reviewed by Sajid.

Based on discussion with team - this currently does not require QA pass until we have this reviewed by Editorial team first.
There is a meeting setup by Carrie to review this further.

Since we want to hold off on full QA testing until we implement the new MathJax release, we are reverting the changes detailed above. The two code changes reverted were:
- in content.css, change the font-size of classes "math" and "inlineMath"
- in mathjax.js, add a "SVG.blacker" configuration of 7.

This script can be run in Firebug to change the font on the fly (for experimentation purposes). Note that the font percentage appears twice in this line of code, so needs to be changed twice if you want a different number.

cd(frames[0]);$('.inlineMath').css({"font-size" : "85%"});$('.math').css({"font-size" : "85%"});MathJax.Hub.Queue(['Rerender',MathJax.Hub, 'ebook_container']);

In Chrome Developer Tools, the process is slightly different. You first look at the very bottom of the window, and there will be a dropdown that currently says <top frame>. Change that to select the reader iframe. Then use this line of code:

$('.inlineMath').css({"font-size" : "85%"});$('.math').css({"font-size" : "85%"});MathJax.Hub.Queue(['Rerender',MathJax.Hub, 'ebook_container']);
Reopening to wait until MathJAX 2.1 is released

item.title: [NG-12699] Appification: Spike: Support https for Secure Server to Server communication
item.description:
Figure out what parts of MT stack need to be enhanced to support MT-App Server to Server communication via HTTPS

HTTPS is used for 2 reasons:

  • Make sure we are communicating with the actual app
  • Encrypt the communication

HTTPS behavior will only come to play if the app end points are https themselves (as described in the deployment descriptor). Going in production, we expect we will make it a requirement for sensitive app to use HTTPS end points.

AC:

  • Identify components in MindTap that need to be enhanced to support end-points using HTTPS
  • Identify certificate that will be used. Need Ops to install and configure the Certificate
  • Get agreement with the App team re:If the app certificate is not valid (untrusted, expired), MindTap will fail the notification

Technical Notes:

  • This will require a change to Framework piece for Basic REST Client to support HTTPS and fail on certificate error
  • We need to make sure the proper Certificate Authority are installed and configured on the MT Servers

For more information, see: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/MindTap+and+MindApps+Security
item.summary: Appification: Spike: Support https for Secure Server to Server communication

comments.comment: Added Spike findings to https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-12699+Spike+Support+https+for+Secure+Server+to+Server+communication

item.title: [NG-12453] Drop Student: Research and Document Notification Approach with Apps
item.description:
*As an Instructor, CourseCare or SuperAdmin I need the same student roster to exist in both MindTap and the homework apps so that when I perform course management activities (grading, etc) the same roster exists for me to act on.

Acceptance Criteria

Per discussions with homework apps, the required functionality is the app to pull a list of students from MT, rather than MT inform them each time a student is dropped.
**MT will create roster synch functionality so that homework apps can request a list of current students in a MT course.

***Define API or notification, and data needed
***Document in App Dev documentation/App Developer Portal
***Review with homework apps

***Determine how Drop Student impacts MindLinks/Gateway (meeting scheduled with Gateway 12/10 to discuss)

  • Note: AA will not need roster synch because it does not maintain a roster today.
item.summary: Drop Student: Research and Document Notification Approach with Apps

comments.comment:
Do we soft delete(Keep the data and mark as dropped) students, so they can be added back and their data(takes/scores etc) can be re-stored ? If Yes, App Also need to soft delete.

Do we need to notify to LMS also about student drop, so they can update the gradebook ?

The proposed approach is not to rely on a synchronous mechanism but rather on a PULL model where apps get the Roster information from MindTap when they need it. Apps have communicated that they would prefer a CLUI based API, so here is what we are proposing: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/CLUI+Roster+Service
proposal written, reviewed internally and sent to app partners.
Reviewed and approved by Web Assign. CNow seems ok but have not look much in how they will approach the manual grading feature at large.

item.title: [NG-12452] Drop Student: Inform Cengage Brain
item.description:
As an Instructor, CourseCare or SuperAdmin I need the ability to drop a student from the MindTap course and have that information communicated to Cengage Brain so that the student can no longer access MindTap from Brain

Background

Students who access MindTap via Cengage Brain should not be able to login to MindTap from Brain. In order to do this, MindTap needs to inform Cengage Brain that the student has been dropped from MindTap.

Acceptance Criteria

  • When instructor Drops Student from within Progress App (NG-7470):
  • IF the Course utilizes Cengage Brain, meaning it does NOT use MindLinks
    • MT informs Cengage Brain the student has dropped:
      Per Kevin T, MindTap can use the same services already in place with Brain and send:

OLRws.removeEnrollment():
token – Admin account token
guid – User’s guid
contextId – Course key corresponding to the enrollment

**If we do not receive a success from Brain, MT will not allow the Drop Student and will display an error back to the user.

Note for testing: Cengage Brain's response is to remove the Course from the Student's dashboard so they can no longer access the MindTap.
The student may in the future return to the course by entering a course key again.
item.summary: Drop Student: Inform Cengage Brain

comments.comment:
See expected results values to decide whether to fail the transaction or not.

COURSE_NOT_FOUND: no need to fail

Ideally removing enrollment for a user that is not enrolled should also not fail, which actually should be SUCCESS so no work needed for that :)

Background

Today user information is displayed on the user page in the Cengage Admin organization. Students are also listed on the users page for the snapshot.

Acceptance Criteria

*If a student has been successfully dropped from a particular course, the student should no longer appear on the user page for the snapshot. This will have the effect of not allowing impersonation as that student.

Acceptance Criteria

  • If a student has been previously dropped, they will return by returning to Cengage Brain and return via a new access code, just like they would as a new student.
  • MT should check to see if the student was previously dropped and if yes, return them and their previous scores to the Progress App. The class average for any assignments will also be re-calculated for those assignments.

item.title: [NG-13021] clui sso.js is stealing JQuery and clui
item.description:
As per our guidelines, public APIs (i.e. used by external apps) should not import JQuery in any way that could conflict with the host app. Efforts were made to remove JQuery from clui/app, hub, inline, activity. During that initial effort, the sso.js library, used by Cengage Apps that integrates with SSO, was missed. Since it is public API used by CNow, Aplia and LAMS, we want it to be cleaned up of any reference to JQuery.

Issue: Importing JQuery twice on a page (host app and SSO) can cause issues on the page (plugins not being available for example) and forces the host to use a non-conflict version of JQuery.

AC:

  • JQuery is no more imported by SSO.js
  • SSO should also probably not steal clui either
  • a jasmine test loads all the public apis: app, hub, inline, attempt, activity, sso, nav and verifies JQuery is not loaded

Tech notes:

  • SSO.js does use JQuery for some event handling and other utils function. That might requiring inlining some of the JQuery logic directly in SSO.js
item.summary: clui sso.js is stealing JQuery and clui

comments.comment: We'd want to make sure this has no impact on the DA+ app.
Only to be looked at in 2.5 if it is found to be part of the fix for 12839

After talking with Alexis here is a proposed plan of action:

1. remove steal of jquery and clui
2. define Clui namespace if not defined directly in sso.js
3. add a new utility function that can be used to implement replacement for jquery method. Proposed name: clui/app/apputils.js as it is utils for public API used in app frames.
4. sso.js steals nojquery.js
5. nojquery.js implements extend and $.extend is replaced by Clui.nojquery.extend
6. nojquery.js implements simple bind(element, event, callback) or alternatively use plain Javascript in SSO.js to add addOnEventListener for window messages
7. .ready can be replaced by binding on load of the window, although a bit less efficient to .ready implementation
8. in place of 6/7 investigate if clui/hub cannot be used instead (require a change to sso_manager.js). If possible that would be a preferred approach.

Note that JMVC 3.3 will offer to safely steal jquery by having jquery not invade the global namespace: steal('jquery', function(jquery) {...}) but that will not be available in time, and ideally there should be very little need of JQuery for public CLUI API that mostly rely on exchange of data between MindTap and MindApp frames through clui/hub.

Some utility function can be copied/adapted from https://github.com/bitovi/canjs/blob/master/util/mootools/mootools.js

item.title: [NG-12969] Nullpointer when accessing MindTap if assignments set up with invalid data
item.description:
When assignments are set up with values which are not acceptable to MindTap or without value that are required, ie) possible points = null, scoring strategy = null, users receive a null pointer exception when attempting to launch the MindTap (see attached screenshot).

Assignments should not be set up with invalid values, but MindTap does nothing to prevent it today. We need to either prevent assignments from being set up with invalid values.

Here are messages for different conditions.
1. MaxScore
Invalid check :(null, MaxScore <=0 and not a number for example "abc")
Error: Invalid Possible Points. Value must be greater than 0.

2. MaxTakes
Invalid Check : For MaxTakes <=0 exclude -1 ( -1 is valid for unlimied takes) and not a number for example "abc":
Error: Invalid Max # of Attempts. Value must be either greater than 0 or -1 for Unlimited Attempts.

3. ScoreStrategy
Check : For invalid values :
Error: Invalid Scoring Strategy value.

Please note that the null value is also invalid for the scorable activities for all three attributes.

item.summary: Nullpointer when accessing MindTap if assignments set up with invalid data

comments.comment:
This, should be a story. The A/C
1. When Adding an Assignable activity and App Sends the invalid data, show error message and do not add activity.
2. When editing an assignable activity, do not override the attributes if the attributes not present in the data sent by App.

What we should do with existing data,
Suggestion :
If still data is invalid data, MindTap should handle error and set the following default values:
a. If max takes not defined (null), use 0 as max takes and remaining takes. ( Or we should use default to 1 so atleast activity can be launched.)
b. If max score is not defined use 1 as max score. ( or 0 but the problem calculating the % with 0 it will be infinite.)
c. If scoring strategy not defined use default 1, BEST_SCORE_STRATEGY

Here are messages for different conditions. Please provide correct wordings for these messages.
1. MaxScore
Invalid check :(null, MaxScore <=0 and not a number for example "abc")
Message: maxScore must have a valid value.

2. MaxTakes
Invalid Check : For MaxTakes <=0 exclude -1 ( -1 is valid for unlimied takes) and not a number for example "abc":
Message MaxTakes must have a valid value.

3. ScoreStrategy
Check : For invalid values :
Message ScoreStrategy must have a valid value.

Please note that the null value is also invalid for the scorable activities for all three attributes.

This issue was logged as defect but after discussion with PO added new requirement to prevent invalida data during add/update activity flow.
Changes been done to add validation for maxScore/maxAttemts and scoring strategy for scorable activity and committed under master branch.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Activity add/edit flow was allowing invalid data entries for scorable activity.

item.title: [NG-12425] Prevent Snapshot creation until acknowledgement has been received from the homework apps
item.description:
As a production, editor or superadmin user, I want to prevent snapshot creation til all apps have acknowledged it's ability to commit the (last) working copy changes in their app so that I know that the HW apps are in sync with the Master.

Steps to get into this situation:
1. Create a working copy
2. Make changes
3. If changes are made in a homework app, the app is notified via lifecycle events of each change.
4. Commit working copy to master and send notification to commit working copy changes to homework app
5. MT should NOT wait to receive an acknowledgement from the homework app before proceeding to commit working copy changes on MT side.
BUT
6. MT will prevent Snapshot creation, a new WC creation and Push to Snapshot till the acks are received or an admin override is performed.

Creating a snapshot while in this state will result in the snapshot being created without the working copy changes in the homework app.

Acceptance criteria

  • If working copy commit notification to homework app has a status of In Progress:
    • prevent snapshots from being created
      • Cengage Brain and LMS will allow the course to be created on their side but when the user attempts to launch into the MT for the first time, MT will capture that request and issue a warning message to the user

Messaging will be implemented in NG-10751 story [send a message back to students and instructors from either Gateway(MindLinks) or Cengage Brain (dashboard) access
separate message for instructors - to try again from the instructor dashboard or LMS
for students- message to indicate that course has not been created yet;to contact their instructor]

  • visual indicator on the master's page that the master is restricted
  • will unlock automatically when the ACK is returned successfully

Testing Note

there could be HW from more than one app in a MT. Need to check additions/deletions of HW Activities in a WC for all HW Apps, and combos of them

  • the 'lock'(restricted state) will be on Snapshot creation until the ACK is received or a superadmin override

implementation considerations

  • For Apps that do use the WC commit event, lift flag when working copy commit event from app ACK has been received and Save is finished

Test scenario

  • may have more than one HW provisioned to a WC so need to test waiting for ACK for CNOW, Aplia and WebAssign (not AA) - need to wait until all HW Apps returned successful ACK before releasing the lock
item.summary: Prevent Snapshot creation until acknowledgement has been received from the homework apps

item.title: [NG-12310] Refactor nbreader to return tocID separate from viewURI
item.description:
As a developer, I want to refactor the nbreader service to return tocID/chapterID separate from viewUri so that we can launch more easily.

Want to update launch of reader so it happens via a Clui.app launch function similar or a refactored Clui.app.update that popout.js uses now. This would replace the launch via url hash parameters.
Reasons:
-url hash history adds complexity and doesn’t mesh well with lpn history when using browser back button.
-app update is a simpler API that is less vulnerable to timing/race condition issues
-supports separation of launch location data vs. display or state data when launching reader

(Per Ben)
We can use the existing Clui.hub.pub('appAction.data.update') code in nb_app_controller.js to launch an app rather than a url. Currently this is used with the large tables popout.js to hand data to the app on launch. It could be co-opted to run with reader. the nb apps controller would hand in launch data like tocId, chapterId, sectionId, elementId, etc and then reader would receive that information and respond by navigating to location. This update code would also work when reader was already open but needed to respond to a navigation change. We would then update all places that launch/update the location of the reader with the same update code so that opening and navigating in reader flow through one API.

There is a quick and dirty bit of code in branch https://github.com/CengageEng/ng-ui/tree/NG-12167 that shows this idea in action for some scenarios like launching both regular and fullbook readers as well as a few bookmark scenarios.
item.summary: Refactor nbreader to return tocID separate from viewURI

item.title: [NG-13185] (Demo) Support extend/merge highlights for standalone MathML

When a user creates a new highlight within an existing highlighted section it will merge the complete existing highlight along with any new user selected text or MathML. The merged content will then be updated in the Notepad as a single entry, and likely with a merge into a single entry into the database.

Extending/Merging Scenarios:
We need to consider the merging and extension into any one of the content blocks with the other:

Content Blocks

  • Inline math then text
  • Text then Inline Math
  • Block Only

  • Text then Block
  • Text

will this fix the current limitation where selection/highlights cannot begin/end on a mathml formula

item.title: [NG-12635] Enable addition of FuncUnit tests back to ng-ui
item.description:
Steps :
1. Create a functional test that exemplifies the kind of functional test that we expect to add to FuncUnit going forward and commit.
2. Add FuncUnit back to our CI build for ng-ui.
3. We will have a developer learning session on how to write a good FuncUnit test.
4. We will begin to add tests to FuncUnit.

item.title: [NG-12797] Fail the UI build when there are errors creating a production.js

The grunt build system should fail the Jenkins build when it encounters an error creating a production.js file. Otherwise, a bad build may be deployed to the QA environments.

For an example of this happening, see the logs at http://pipeeng.corp.local/hudson/view/mindtap/job/ng-ui_MASTER_PACKAGE_PUBLISH_grunt/12/

item.title: [NG-12798] Prevent debugging code from entering production
item.description:
Currently, developers may accidentally check in code intended for debugging. Specific statements can cause problems: uses of "console.log" will break on IE. Uses of "debugger;" will interrupt the user on Firefox.

We should put a solution in place to prevent these problematic statements from entering the product. Several ideas discussed include:

  • a client-side Git hook installed on every workstation (a proof-of-concept of this exists already...see Dick)
  • a server-side Git hook installed on Github
  • a grunt task added to the standard developer build sequence

Whoever picks up this card should weigh the pros and cons of each approach, and drive consensus on a technical approach.
item.summary: Prevent debugging code from entering production

item.title: [NG-12940] Create BaseMySQLTest for running data layer unit tests against a live mysql db
item.description:
We need a base test class / mechanism created (e.g. in nbcore-common-test), which allows us to write unit-level tests for a repository which interact with a live mysql server instance.

This needs to:

  • create database on global test start, ideally from dbmaintain (in maven, perhaps?)
  • begin a transaction at the start of each test
  • rollback that transaction at the end of each test

Note that the existing AbstractNBServiceTest does this transactional stuff already, and could possibly be repurposed for this. It may end up that the bulk of the work for this story is in working out the mechanism for creating the mysql db from dbmaintain on start and tearing it down on end, and we should be able to run our existing suite of tests unchanged.
item.summary: Create BaseMySQLTest for running data layer unit tests against a live mysql db

comments.comment: Need a walkthrough regarding modules (nb, nbcore-common, and nbcore-common-test) and packages - seems like a mess. and we can't tell what "should" go where.... (i.e., what is deprecated and what is our goal). There is what looks like duplication between nb and nbcore-common-test.

We implemented a BaseMySqlServiceTest, which uses a MySqlFrameworkModule. It does a dbmaintain:update before running, and it uses the "test" mysql schema on the CI server. We also changed a single integration test: ActivityCommentServiceIntegrationTest, to use the new base test.

Proposals for next steps:

We could not put it in nbcore-common-tests, because the database scripts live in nbcore-webapp. I would like to see either:
     1 - move scripts and dbmaintain logic into nbcore (the parent module that contains common-tests, common, and webapp), and move the BaseMySqlServiceTest to common-tests
     2 - (preferred) move all of the integration tests into a separate module, so integration tests are separated out from unit tests.

Also Jared Mac suggested maybe creating a new schema instance (with a random name) with every run, and tearing it down afterward, instead of leaving it all in "test". Another thing to consider.

All nbcore db access tests are now ported to MySQL from in memory Derby database. This allows to exercise tests with same database that real application uses to close the gap.
No special setup or action is required on developers end or on CI side (just pull the latest nbcore master branch and run build/tests as usual)
Code changes are limited to test files hence there shouldn't be any regression/functional impact
Changes are verified on Mac, Windows & CI server
All new db access tests need to Extend from BaseMySQLTest instead of AbstactNBWebAppServiceTest
Under the covers, Maven test goal creates new MySQL database "testdb_xxx" (xxx is timestamp) and schema & initial data is seeded with dbmaintain scripts. testdb_xxx db will automatically dropped when tests are finished running.
You can still run single db test from within Eclipse. But, testdb created from eclipse is different from mvn run and will be reused to cut down db creation and data seeding.
All db constraints are now enforced (no longer can omit non-null fields; this is due to gap in JDO annotation in the entity vs. what it is in DB)
If Table A has a foreign key relationship to Table B. Row can only be inserted into A after inserting into B
Since we have pre seeded data in role, org, user tables, when calling find or findAll on these entities might bring rows than your test is exercising so make sure you are accounting pre-seeded data in test assertions
If you ever have stranded test databases in MySQL due to abnormal test failures, use clean_test_dbs.sh (located @ ng-istruct repo under build-scripts folder OR from ng-nbcore/nbcore-webapp/content folder); this will drop testdb_xxx dbs from MySQL

item.title: [NG-12941] Have some masters in production that show an Error Status in the Masters page - but all component status records are green
item.description:
There are currently at least 3 titles in production that show an error status on the Masters page even though all refresh status are Green and the title has been refreshed recently

SSO ISBN: 9781133213192
SSO ISBN: 9781133596547
SSO ISBN: 9781133796121

One common thread between these 3 is that it looks like, at some point, the push failed (there is data in the ERROR_TEXT field in the COMPONENT_STATUS table for the Push operation – even though the status is now Successful) and maybe there's some scenario by which the status is not getting cleaned up after a successful push or refresh. We would need to do more investigation to determine how these books got into this state. It doesn't look like there's anything wrong with these titles – it's just that the status field on the SNAPSHOT table is incorrect.

I used this query to find some of these records :

select * from SNAPSHOT where ID in (select snapshot_id from SNAPSHOT_COMPONENT_STATUS WHERE COMPONENT_ID IN
(SELECT ID FROM COMPONENT_STATUS where OPERATION = 'PUSH'AND STATUS=2 AND ERROR_TEXT IS NOT NULL))and status = 2.
item.summary: Have some masters in production that show an Error Status in the Masters page - but all component status records are green

comments.comment:
I think I've found what may be causing this issue: Whenever we update a master's ComponentStatus collection, we call DefaultSnapshotService.updateMasterRefreshStatus(). However, DefaultNextBookResource.copyAnnotationsToSnapshot() fails to make this call to update the master refresh status.

Next step is to reproduce this issue, focusing on the "push to snapshot" functionality which passes through the above methods.

I'm putting this issue back in the queue as I focus on a 2.5 bug.

The issue has just been emailed to: *vitaliy.zakharov@contractor.cengage.com*, \\
with subject: *(NG-12941) Have some masters in production that show an Error Status in the Masters page - but all component status records are green * \\
 \\
and content:\\
----
I can give hints on testing this, when this is picked up for verification.

item.title: [NG-12954] Refactor category app aggregator to live in the parent frame
item.description:
The category app aggregator is currently implemented as a separate app living in an iframe, but since it renders dock actions within itself, it's breaking our contract with dock actions and causing subtle bugs, as well as the inability to send a message directly to one of those app actions.

Since this is really a native platform feature, and not an 'app', this should be changed to render completely in the parent frame as a div, rather than an iframe, in the same manner as the search dock action does today. Inner apps managed by the aggregator should be rendered in iframes as they are today, but in the same manner as other dock actions (e.g. using the nb_apps/app_action_iframe.ejs view).
item.summary: Refactor category app aggregator to live in the parent frame

item.title: [NG-13050] Regression: Safari 5/Mac 10.6: Reader: MathML is not rendering properly when Chapter containing MathML is the first one to open in the current session
item.description:
Tested in Safari 5.1.5 on Mac 10.6.8.

Reproducible in Reader only (not repro in Full Book).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Uberdoc (cache does not matter).
2. From LPN launch e.g., Ch 12 (or 2, or 13) -> TOC is displayed.

Actual result: MathML is not rendering correctly on TOC page (Ch 12, 13).

3. Start navigation through Reader.

Actual result: MathML is not displayed properly.
(Note: if HLs are created, MathML does not have HL background in some cases but it appears after refreshing the page; in Notepad MathML is displayed as plain text and it will not be displayed properly after refreshing the page).

4. Switch to another Chapter and come back: MathML is rendering proeprly.
item.summary: Regression: Safari 5/Mac 10.6: Reader: MathML is not rendering properly when Chapter containing MathML is the first one to open in the current session

comments.comment: Soumya has tested in Safari 6.0.2 on Mac 10.7.5: the issue is not reproducible in this br/OS combination. Updating the title accordingly.

item.title: [NG-12977] 9781285051376 Ebbing_Ch. 10 (Global Platform) Page Up/Down Issue
item.description:
Observed on QA. See attached screen shots for behavior that I observed occurring intermittently on any page in Ch. 10 of Ebbing. I asusme this is a global platform issue. Steps to reproduce:

1. Start on a section page for best results, although also occurs on the chapter overview page.
2. Click the Page Down button on your keyboard.
3. Sometimes, this causes the MTR font buttons to disappear and a black band to appear at the bottom of the screen. The Chapter Overview button is now floating at the top of the page, instead of being anchored in the button bar above the page.
4. Click the Page Up button.
5. Your screen may return to normal, or the font buttons may stay missing, the black band may persist, and the Chapter Overview button may float at the top of the page.
item.summary: 9781285051376 Ebbing_Ch. 10 (Global Platform) Page Up/Down Issue

comments.comment: Could this be a result of the mobile work? I couldn't reproduce it on QAE. If its related to mobile (from pre-2.5), the new swipeview implementation may have fixed it?
this is a production bug and likely related to accessibility, according to scott
This seems similar to an old production bug NG-6696 though with different steps.
I tried to reproduce on QAE using Chrome on the Mac to no avail.
I observed this on Win/FF

I can reproduce this consistently in Firefox on a Mac. I've noticed that ereader.css has a .ContextMenuAnnotation definition that sets height to 100%. I don't know why, but when I remove this style rule then I can't reproduce this issue. This style rule has been in there for a long time, so I'll follow up with someone in UX and see if this is really a necessary rule and maybe we can remove it.

item.title: [NG-12733] (Concern): Test/Characterization task for 2.5 : Student is able to login into Mindtap application through main Login page.
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. SSO login: s-login.cengage.com and login via a student account e.g. "jhqabentstu2@test.cengage.com".
2. Open any book
3. Copy the Browser's URL and launch in new refreshed browser
4. Verify that Main login page is displayed.
5. Login via another student account e.g. "funct_test2@qait.com/ A111111"

Actual Result: Student is able to login into Mindtap application through main Login page.

Please refer to attached video << StudentLoginViaMainScreen >>

From Jeff : Further characterization of behavior. Items 2 and 3 would be of particular concern (expecially #3) - as it would seem to allow users visibility of a title that they are not entitled to.

1. User has valid coursekey for the snapshot and has launched into that snapshot from cbrain. BM launch works after login and user lands in the snapshot. (jhqabcstu5@test.cengage.com - 1Password)

2. User doesn't have course key - HAS logged into mindtap - HAS an access code for the same title. BM launch works after login and user lands in snapshot – but they are NOT added to the course (they don't get added to User_org_profile so won't show up in progress app) . (jhqabentstu1@test.cengage.com / password)

3. User doesn't have a course key – but HAS logged into mindtap and does NOT have an access code for the same title – BM launch works after login and user lands in snapshot. They are not added to the course (they don't get added to User_org_profile so won't show up in progress app) : (jhqabcstu7@test.cengage.com / 1Password)

4. User has never logged into mindtap (even if they have a cbrain account and an access code for the title) - the login fails on the admin login screen (jhqabcstu6@test.cengage.com / 1Password)

You can use the URL below and the accounts above to test this out in QAF :

http://qaf.ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/index.html?nbId=15542&nbNodeId=922034#!&parentId=922035
item.summary: (Concern): Test/Characterization task for 2.5 : Student is able to login into Mindtap application through main Login page.

For you to review and determine priority. Putting in Next RElease Candidate for now

item.title: [NG-13074] IE9> Annotations: Switching Chapters via Notepad or LPN makes Annotations disappear in Reader
item.description:
NOTE:
1)Tested on all the browsers, QN navigation from NP to Reader issue exists ONLY on IE9
2) Issue reproducible on IE9 for math and non-math books
3) Issue reproducible on production code on QAF

Navigation from Notepad to Reader - Steps to Reproduce:
1) Create multiple HL/QN in the same chapter - ex. chapter 2 , 2.2a on Uberdoc
2) With chapter 2 (any section or on 2.2a) open in the reader, open the notepad and try to navigate from NP to reader via HL/QN goto link. WORKS
3) Now, via LPN go to another chapter ex. 12.
4) Open the notepad and using the goto link on the NP for given HL/QN navigate to the reader - DOES NOT WORK.

WORKAROUND:
Refresh the page to see the HL/QN again.

Navigation via LPN:
1. Create Annotations in Chapter 2.
2. Create Annotations in Chapter 12 (Reader stays open in Ch 12).
3. Open LPN, switch to Chapter 2 and navigate to a page with Annotations -> Annotations are not displayed.
item.summary: IE9> Annotations: Switching Chapters via Notepad or LPN makes Annotations disappear in Reader

item.title: [NG-13108] Bookmarks:-Bookmarks icon not appearing on the RA page for a snapshot where zcollab is provisioned
item.description:

Steps to Reproduce:-

#1.Log in with superadmin on QAE.

#2.Click over the organizations > BOSTON COLL-WALTHAM > Search for the course key "MTPNTN5PNSRT" > launch the snapshot :- Mankiw_Micro_QA_SSO_ISBN

Accepted Result:- Bookmarks icon should be displayed for these snapshot.

comments.comment:
Jared - Can you please have a look on these particular snapshots that why Bookmark is not appearing.

- Vinay

I don't see it in one of my masters, either -- http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/index.html?nbId=7816&nbNodeId=501897&isMaster=true&contentKey=4f8eff9a453816c3f1b04acd

ZCollab for one...

I have a feeling that zcollab is somehow messing with the other apps provisioned, but it'll take some time to hunt down the actual reason.

this probably is connected to more than zCollab, we need to test bookmarks w/ the Homework apps on QAF

should this be moved to Core team?

Lowering the priority as it seems very specific to 1 title on QAE.

item.title: [NG-13143] Investigate ways to make math rendering faster
item.description:
Look at ways to:
1. Decrease the footprint of MathJax
2. Make math rendering faster
3. Simplify the interaction between MathJax event handling and MT

We are looking for ways to make math rendering significantly faster and easier.

Time-box this at 3 points.
Ideal output:
Produce two sample pages showing the same math formulas.
1st page uses the "classic" way of MathJax
2nd page uses the faster way.

Produce a comparison of the two pages w.r.t. time and memory.
item.summary: Investigate ways to make math rendering faster
