item.title: [NG-13235] Update Transform, CSS and Reader to align specific MathML content
item.description:
change the alignment of offset MathML in MT based on a position attribute we apply to the <cl:math-expr> wrapping tag via Transform/CSS and platform change as the alignment in the MathML was not working in MathJAX

Components to be changed : Transform, Application CSS/javascript code.

  • Transform needs to convert position="right" to style="text-align:right"
  • If there is no position attribute on cendoc then transform should default to "center" alignment
  • Application/CSS : Remove "text-alignment" styles from "equation" and "Math_SVG_Display" classes
  • Application/Javascript : Remove inline style attribute text-align from math div.
  • alignment will be seen in reader and full book

use uberdoc section 13-6 for an example

would require a refresh of ALL math titles that have this specific content as math alignment will be removed from MathMLCSS and will be added to reader.xml during transform.

  • alignment in notepad will not be supported (no alignment is currently maintained)
  • existing apps will not be affected (other places that we render math - not reader/full book) like glossary popup, image credit/caption, table content and header, LPN, TOC, Reader Headers (Chapter title, A-head, B-head)etc..
      • emily to provide new examples in uberdoc
  • warren accounting title(s) 9780538480895, 9780538475006 have MathML but do not use this alignment in the XML. these MTs should not be affected for before or after a refresh
    • also check ebbing and mcmurry
item.summary: Update Transform, CSS and Reader to align specific MathML content

comments.comment: Jim already did the transform changes. Can begin dev; still require updated samples from Emily in uberdoc

Code for this is ready to go, but waiting on content help. We found, when implementing the above changes, that the example in 13-6 breaks. The extra spaces, which content used to force it to right-align, pushes the formula off the screen altogether once we put in the right-align. I think that this is not a real scenario - that there will never been a case where extra spaces are in a formula AND a right-align is in the style. However if that is not true, we will need to do additional work.

My questions for Content are:
1 - do we have any more examples?
2 - do we know of a case when content will use both spaces and align=right at the same time, to line things up?
3 - if the answer to (2) is 'no', can we remove the extra spaces from the uberdoc example? This story can't be tested until that happens.
Emily, please review Karen's comments above

Will look at this tomorrow morning - sorry for the delay.

My initial impression is that using both a "right" position value and hardcoded spaces is not a real case scenario. But, I'd like to understand why the MathML is running off the page. I'd expect the "edge" of the equation to be flush-right with MindTap Reader text regardless of whether the equation ends with a character or a space. But, I need to investigate this some more tomorrow morning.

For now, the code is pushed to remote branch NG-13235 in ng-ui and ng-nbreader. If somebody else picks this up while I'm on vacation, that's where you can find it. (I will be in tomorrow, but then off for several days)

Emily: Ravish and I think that it's because of the way the browser calculates the width of the svg space, it seems to think it's wider than the page. When we changed the mock cendoc xml locally to use the same number of spaces, but narrower ones (&#x2006), then it came into view, though still pushed too far to the right. I can share my screen tomorrow and show you. I don't want to check it into master without an answer to this though, for fear of this affecting real content that might fall into this scenario.

I've requested that more variations of this equation be added to the uberdoc (in MTQA-15748), but I think we need to support the following scenarios:

* MathML "row" ends with space entity
* MathML "row" begins with space entity
* MathML "row" begins with math text
* MathML "row" ends with math text

Also attaching screenshot of QAE marked up with what I expect the rendering to be. We can review at 10:30 this morning.

item.title: [NG-13152] Regression: Dictionary App: Selecting a word from HL to view in dictionary does not work
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1) Launch any title and create a HL on text
2) Select a word from HL and via CM look up in the dictionary.

Actual result: Entire HL is selected for the look up on the dictionary
Expected: Alike on QAF , only the selected word must be looked up in the dictionary.

Note: compared with QAF and it works well.
item.summary: Regression: Dictionary App: Selecting a word from HL to view in dictionary does not work

comments.comment: Can we have someone look at this bug and see if there's a low risk solution for 2.5?

This was caused by an improvement in the highlight code - if a user selects a bunch of text, and highlights it, then selects a smaller amount of text inside, then picks a new color, the entire highlighted text changes color. It was very easy to click on a highlight and actually make a small, one-character selection. If we didn't expand the selection, you'd lose pretty much your entire highlight. NG-12763

The above change is incompatible with the way one would expect the dictionary to work, and the current API only allows one or the other. We need to choose which is preferred for 2.5, and create a story to enhance the selection API in the future to pass both sets of data (actual selection and expanded selection), and let the app decide what to do with it. (Note, be sure to make sure to make the new version backward compatible, for apps who have already implemented it.)
Assigning story to Carrie for PO input.

Carrie -

My two cents is that we'd need to keep the M-W integration and our API as-is...

- Amber
Need to figure out strategy for supporting single word selection for dictionary app when the word is contained in a highlight/quicknote
Release Note: Workaround. Copy/paste the word into the Dictionary app instead of using the contextual menu dictionary option
whomever picks this up, please set up a meeting to review this with Greg, Amber, Carrie, QA, Dick, Joe, Jared S., Karen
A meeting to decide on an approach has been scheduled for 12/19.

currently the Dictionary app is included on the CM when a mathml formula or equation is selected and this sends mathml over to the dictionary app. will this change fix this or is there a separate story that needs to be played?
Carrie, please open another story for that. We should also test other structured content, like italicized words and glossary terms.

Per meeting on 12/19:

We will revert the behavior to be similar to 2.5. That is, the selection event will include the bounds of the user's original selection, not the expanded selection. However, the event will also contain any annotation references that overlap the selection. This will be used by the notepad app to calculate the expanded selection itself.

item.title: [NG-11631] MT Displays Manual Grading Indication in Progress - Activity tab in Progress
item.description:
As an instructor, I need to see an indication that there are student submissions for an assignment that require manual grading when I am viewing a list of all assignment in the Progress App so that I am aware of which assignments require my attention

Acceptance Criteria

"- For assignments which require manual grading,on the Activities tab in the Progress App MT displays the following columns:

Average Score

  • if none of the assignments have a score, display a dash
    -if at least 1 student's assignment has a recorded score, display current average score based on exisiting recorded scores

Submitted (= to # of students who have at least 1 completed take for the assignment)

Notes

  • If the assignment is Practice, display Practice indicator.
  • If the assignment requires Manual Grading, display visual indicator and # of assignments remaining to be manually graded.

Example: 28 students have at least 1 completed take of an assignment reequiring manual grading. The instructor has previously graded 5 of these assignments and the average of the 5 is 90%. The colums display:
27 students have submitted the assignment and 5 of these submissions have been manually graded already.

  • Score column would display the current Average: 90%, Submitted: 28, Notes: (23) , indicating 23 remain to be graded. "
item.summary: MT Displays Manual Grading Indication in Progress - Activity tab in Progress

item.description:

Any user in snapshot "IAUber13" on QAF in Cengage Sales Org can be used.

Steps to reproduce:

or
Launch Uberdoc with already existing HLs to Math and open any RA (not necessarily the one you have math HLs in).
2. Open NP and confirm all HLs are properly displayed: no text or formula corruption.
3. WITHOUT closing NP click on Full Book icon from Dock (maybe other apps from Dock - need to check). (Note: the same result will be if instead of FB, a user enlarges Table - I chose section 2-2b with Enlargeable Table for testing).
3. WITHOUT closing Full Book click on Reader to bring it on top of FB.
4. On any page, select ANY text (not necessarily Math) and create HLs (if Math was selected or can create QN if non-math content was selected).
5. Click on NP icon from Dock.

Actual result: Math content is corrupted in Notepad, please see the screen shot and video.

Closing and reopening NP does not cure.
Creating another HL/QN while NP is opened or closed will cure NP.
item.summary: QAF: IE9: Math: Annotations/Notepad: Corrupted content in Notepad in certain scenario

comments.comment:
This issue is reproduced with any App as noted above, summarizing few steps see below:

Steps:
Launch Uberdoc which has couple of highlights created
1. Open Notepad and view the highlights display properly. DO NOT CLOSE
2. Open any other app (Full book, Flash Card, Glossary). DO NOT CLOSE
3. Open a RA and create a new highlight on text
4. Select Notepad again from Appdock and display is messed up.

Workarounds: multiple, either you create another highlight or switch to bookmark and come back to notepad all good.

Iryna, assigned this bug to you - please review and add few details - thank you.

a) the Enlargeable table in the workflow you note -
b) check other books (non-math)
c) other browsers, assuming IE9 only issue but please confirm.
d) does this happen when you start creating highlights in a brand new book and follow same steps above.

MAIN DETAIL:
initial highlighting of CERTAIN MathML content corrupts itself and makes other MathML content display corrupted in NP in the scenario above. This MathML content is located in 13-1d and in 13-2 (please see the screen shots 1-4, though there might be more cases).
All the MathML HLs made in THIS Chapter 13 and which are displayed below the content mentioned above are getting corrupted.



Details:
a) The Enlargeable Table workflow: step 3 in the description: instead of opening any App from Dock, navigate to a page with Enlargeable Table and click +: this will make Notepad hide in Dock and EV will be displayed. Then WITHOUT closing EV, create HL/QN and then open Notepad.
b) non-math books cannot have this problem as corruption in Notepad occurs to math content.
c) exists only in IE9.
d) does not matter if it's a brand new book without HL or existing book with HL (step 1 in description).

item.title: [NG-12546] SPIKE: Allow a highlight to begin and end with a formula
item.description:
There will be formulas that begin or end a paragraph or sentence and with the existing implementation, there is no way for the users to select these. Particularly if these formulas are at in the first item in the first sentence of the first paragraph of a reader page or the last item in the last sentence on the reader page.

Spike Outcomes

  • determine a way that will allow a highlight to begin and end on a formula.
  • We need to consider the addition, merging and extension into any one of the content blocks with the other:

Content Blocks

Inline math then text
Text then Inline Math
Block then Text
Text then Block
Block plus block (more than one block level elements together)
also extend merge to begin/end on math

Spike outcomes- create stories

Original Story info

As a MindTap user, I want to highlight a segment of a reading activity that contains text and formulas so that I can easily find it later in a quick glance at the page

Proposed user experience (open to improvement): identical to highlighting text; when I click and drag over text, the text and any formulas are selected; then a context menu appears with the option to highlight.

Scenario: selection begins with text, ends with text, and contains one or more formulas

This is provided for in NG-12394

Scenario: selection begins with a formula at the start of a paragraph or block, and ends with text

Scenario: selection begins with text, and ends with a formula at the end of a paragraph or block

Acceptance criteria:

  • Highlights persist on page refresh or on navigating to another chapter and then navigating back to the highlight

Out of scope scenarios:

  • Highlighting formulas in a table or an image caption

Accepted limitations:

  • User experience: formulas may not have a “selected” appearance during the act of selection; background color may only be applied to formulas after the mouse is released
item.summary: SPIKE: Allow a highlight to begin and end with a formula

Also worth noting that this is just a mismatched filename between the code and the image
Metadata provides : Art & Humanities
Code is looking for : http://ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/images/discipline_titles/small/art_&_humanities.png
Filename in the repo : http://ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/images/discipline_titles/small/arts_and_humanities.png

So it may be a matter of just renaming the filename (I'm not sure how the code doing the mapping of discipline -> filename).

Issue is a mismatch between the file name and what the code is looking for.

Metadata provides : Art & Humanities

Code is looking for : http://ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/images/discipline_titles/small/art_&_humanities.png

Filename in the repo : http://ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/images/discipline_titles/small/arts_and_humanities.png

So it may be a matter of just renaming the filename (I'm not sure how the code doing the mapping of discipline -> filename).

item.title: [NG-13286] See if we can do "remote run" builds with Jenkins
item.description: I'd like for developers to be able to do a "remote run" build against the prod CI. This means that you could run a build using a predefined job existing on the prod CI, with the current local state of the dev's machine. This can be used to verify that local changes won't break the build, and also perhaps for pushing local branch builds out to the dev integration environments.
item.summary: See if we can do "remote run" builds with Jenkins

comments.comment:
See:
http://www.jetbrains.com/teamcity/features/continuous_integration.html for reference.

More info:
http://www.jetbrains.com/teamcity/features/delayed_commit.html

Demo showing a remote run from eclipse:
http://www.jetbrains.com/teamcity/documentation/screenshots/TeamCity2.0.EclipsPlugin.html

item.title: [NG-13288] Clean up author data
item.description:
We should clean up the snapshot table's "author" column.

For course snapshots, the code has been written to pull the author from the snapshot's master. As a result, the SNAPSHOT table has many rows with unused author data. At the very least, we should clean up this data. At its best, we should pull the master author column out into a new table (a new PRODUCT_METADATA table?).

Secondly, java class NextBook has an author field. It appears that this author is no longer being used within the product. Furthermore, since "author" is the only significant column on this table, can we remove this class completely?
item.summary: Clean up author data

item.title: [NG-13294] Firefox: Help Overlay> CM appears while clicking anywhere on the reader page except on bubbles and help bubbles description are also displayed in "MyNotes" app.
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the URL: http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nb/login.html
2. Login with valid Uid/Password: functionaladmin/A111111.
3. Open any book.
4. Navigate to any chapter.
5. Click on "Help" overlay.
6. Click on reader page except the bubbles.

Actual Result: CM appears on clicking on reader page except on bubbles and help bubbles description are displayed in "MyNotes" app.

Please refer to the attached screenshot and zip file <<CM_issue.jpg>> and <<CM_issue.zip>> for more detail.
item.summary: Firefox: Help Overlay> CM appears while clicking anywhere on the reader page except on bubbles and help bubbles description are also displayed in "MyNotes" app.
